Frida Kahlo's Art and Their Hidden Meanings

"Frida Kahlo's Art and Their Hidden Meanings"

"I paint myself because I am often alone and I am the subject I know best." - Frida Kahlo

Home Paintings & Hidden Meanings Legacy
TWO FRIDAS - 1939

SUMMARY:

This painting of "The Two Fridas" was done while Frida was going through her first and only divorce with Diego Rivera in 1939, whom she remarried a year later.

• Represents her dual heritage crisis.

• Memories of an imaginary childhood friend.

• Desperation and loneliness after a divorce.

Learn More

Frida Kahlo created this painting to express both her physical and emotional pain, particularly from her recent divorce with Diego Rivera. She also represents her ongoing health struggles.

• Suffering

• Struggle of Indenity

• Death and Resurrection

• Self-Denial and Sacrifice

Learn More
